text: John Kerry wanted to be Secretary of
State but that job went to Hillary
Clinton he's carved out an important
role in President Obama's foreign policy
anyway James trout profiles him in this
week's magazine my original interest in
Kerry is when I realized that he had
become a kind of diplomatic agent of the
Obama administration in a way that I had
never heard of anybody doing the premise
was can I travel with you and see you do
what you do and he said yes it was only
later that I was told by some of his
aides he had never said yes to that
question before I really concluded that
the most important thing was Afghanistan
Afghanistan and Pakistan and so I waited
for him to go there and i kind of got
kept getting put off and put off and put
off by the time he had scheduled the
trip Osama bin Laden had been killed
I've traveled with Vice President Biden
I've traveled with the UN
secretary-general it's always hard when
you are traveling with the big guy right
because if you travel inside a bubble
the good thing about Kerry is that he
hates to have a big entourage she
travels by himself typically when he
goes somewhere he has one aide that's it
he's very quiet and he's very
interrogative with the people he chose
to talk to he genuinely wanted to see
the world as they see it Kerry is a
consensus seeking person which is a good
thing diplomatically good thing in terms
of his role as a senator it's a
limitation maybe when you were trying to
think about a hard question and you
don't want to stray too far away from
what you understand to be mainstream
opinion i think in a situation like
Afghanistan and Pakistan with the facts
have changed so much I don't know
whether he's fully acknowledged
the failure of the effort and has fully
allowed himself to consider whether
there should be a big big change
supposed to a wheel slope step change
but I saw a person who was who was
comfortable and who was really enjoying
himself and it was completely into the
moment I mean totally totally focused he
didn't want to be anywhere else except
where he was at the same time he's an
ambitious person you don't run for
president and almost win if you're not
an ambitious person he wanted to be
Secretary of State in 2009 he'd like to
be Secretary of State in 2012 or 2013 it
is a real ambition that he has I also
think if it doesn't happen and he
continues as chairman of Senate Foreign
Relations that's okay too
you
